block.p: A Baghdad Neighborhood, Once Hopeful, Now Reels In Ghazalia, a typical section of Baghdad, people are at the end of their patience, worn down by hardships of daily life, and bitterness at the occupation is festering.
Family Tie to Thurmond? A 78-year-old woman says she is the daughter of the late Senator Strom Thurmond of South Carolina and a black maid.

A Baghdad Neighborhood, Once Hopeful, Now Reels In Ghazalia, a typical section of Baghdad, people are at the end of their patience, worn down by hardships of daily life, and bitterness at the occupation is festering.
Family Tie to Thurmond? A 78-year-old woman says she is the daughter of the late Senator Strom Thurmond of South Carolina and a black maid.
A Sooner Wins the Heisman Jason White, the Oklahoma quarterback, beat out Larry Fitzgerald, the Pittsburgh receiver.
A Gas-Drilling Rush During the Bush administration, gas drilling has greatly accelerated in the Wyoming wilderness.

Rowland Is Asked to Leave The Connecticut Democratic Party leader called on Gov. John G. Rowland to step aside during a federal inquiry, but the governor said through an aide that he had no intention of doing so.
Shock Over Police Inquiry The story of two New York City detectives accused of robbing a drug courier has echoes of past cases, but to neighbors and fellow officers, the charges are still disturbing.
